faqs.question: In which month does RBI launch the MF survey?
faqs.answer: The RBI launches the MF survey during the month of June every year with the previous financial year ended end-March as the reference date.

faqs.question: What is the frequency of this survey?
Which entities are required to participate in the survey?
faqs.answer: MF companies in India are required to participate in this survey.

faqs.question: How does the MF company submit the MF survey schedule to the RBI?
faqs.answer: Once the survey is launched, MF companies receive an email from RBI along with the soft copy of the survey schedule (Schedule-4) in excel format. The filled-in survey schedule should be sent by email to mf@rbi.org.in.

faqs.question: What if the MF company does not receive the soft copy of the survey schedule by email?
faqs.answer: MF companies can download Schedule-4 from the RBI website or send a request to mfquery@rbi.org.in.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for submission in MF Survey by Mutual Fund companies?
faqs.answer: Mutual fund companies can submit their responses on or before July 15 of every year.

faqs.question: What is the timeline for submission in MF Survey by Asset Management Companies (AMCs)?
faqs.answer: AMCs must submit their annual return on Foreign Liabilities and Assets (FLA) through RBI’s online web-based portal ‘FLAIR’ by July 15 of every year.

faqs.question: How does an AMC report data/submit the FLA return to the RBI?
faqs.answer: Entities can submit the annual return on FLA through the online portal at https://flair.rbi.org.in.

faqs.question: What is the reference period of MF survey?
faqs.answer: The reference period is the immediately preceding financial year (April-March).

faqs.question: If the MF company/AMCs does not have foreign liabilities and assets during the reference period, do they need to participate in the survey?
faqs.answer: Yes, they must submit a NIL survey schedule of MF survey as well as FLA form on the FLAIR portal.

faqs.question: Can a company get an acknowledgment for submission of the MF survey schedule?
faqs.answer: Yes, after submitting the survey schedule to mf@rbi.org.in, the MF company will receive a system-generated acknowledgment.

faqs.question: What information should be reported in MF survey, if the balance sheet of the company is not audited before the due date of submission?
faqs.answer: If the company’s accounts are not audited before July 15, the MF survey schedule should be submitted based on unaudited (provisional) accounts.

faqs.question: If the account closing period of the MF company/AMCs is different from the reference period (end-March), can it report the information as per account closing period?
faqs.answer: No, the MF survey information should be reported for the reference period, based on the company’s internal assessment.
